source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a street-level view of a corner in a Japanese town on a wet, overcast day. A landscaped traffic island with a tree and yellow flowers sits in the foreground. Across the street, a modern building for an "Exterior Garden" business is visible, along with other houses and abundant greenery. Cars can be seen driving along the wet road.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This is a street-level view of a corner in a Japanese town on a wet, overcast day. A landscaped traffic island with a tree and yellow flowers sits in the foreground. Across the street, a modern building for an "Exterior Garden" business is visible, along with other houses and abundant greenery. Cars can be seen driving along the wet road.

generated_critique: The caption focuses on describing the static scenery rather than the motion of the subjects as instructed. The description of the cars' movement is a generic, single phrase ("Cars can be seen driving along the wet road") and lacks the chronological and specific details required. The caption should be revised to remove the descriptions of the weather, the traffic island, and the buildings. Instead, it should chronologically describe the movement of the vehicles: first, a black car drives from right to left, followed by a white car that also moves from right to left around a curve, and finally, a red car enters from the left and drives to the right.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: From a street-level perspective, a black car drives from right to left. A white car then follows, also moving from right to left around a curve in the road. Lastly, a red car enters the frame from the left and drives to the right.
